messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:24): I see text/plain
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:28): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: exactly
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:30): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: btw, have you seen chaals lately? or corresponded with him at least?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:30): I'm wondering if he's planning on sending out any kind of draft agenda for the webapps f2f
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:32): I saw e-mail of him :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:33): I recommend e-mailing, I believe he is in Oslo
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:33): will ping
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:42): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: thanks
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (09:48): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: btw, what was the reason for 350ms? Why not 200 or 500?
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (09:49): for XHR progress events
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (09:50): I implemented a "progressbar" using progress events, and adding support for 350ms made it a bit  jerky
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (09:52): perhaps I should test with a bit smaller value... 150 or something
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:00): bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350, 200 and 500 are allowed, no? :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:01): bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350, I copied this straight from the <video> spec
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:15): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, hmm, just now read the e-mail, weird
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:16): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: the "BITSY" e-mail, you mean?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:17): the one from Nikunj Mehta
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:17): something close to 50ms looks nicer.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:18): that's a lot of events queuing up though
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:18): queuing?
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:19): it still batches quite a few events
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:21): 135 events without timer, 22 with 50ms, 3 with 350ms
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:21): (just a quick test, depends on the quality of this network connection)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:21): 135 events without timer?
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:21): right
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:21): when downloading
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:22): that ofc depends on the implementation
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:22): how often network layer informs other participants that something has happened
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:22): i see
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:23): in the test I'm uploading and downloading 1MB
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:23): is there a visible difference?
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:23): I think the use case for <video> is a bit different
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:24): there is visible difference in my progressbar
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:24): k, so we do 100ms +- 50ms or so for XHR?
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:25): 100ms looks quite ok
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:25): 12 events
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:26): hmm, but there should be some reasoning for the value
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:27): ideally the value would prolly depend on download speed and size of the downloaded object
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:28): so you get less events if you download, say, an order of magnitude more
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:28): though events are cheap
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:29): yeah, and it probably depends on what you want as an app dev
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:31): 50ms would allow 20 frame rate
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:32): I'm fine with 100ms
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:34): fwiw, I'm ok with recommending 50ms as well and leaving out the +- thing
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:34): i'll e-mail the list
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (10:34): ok, thanks
